message.content:
cs.IT, cs.DC, cs.DS, cs.NI, cs.SY. 

The paper deals with the problem of coded distributed computing, which involves encoding a large computational job and distributing it among multiple nodes for parallel processing. This problem is closely related to coding theory and information theory, which suggests that the paper is likely to belong to the cs.IT (Information Theory) sub-category. Additionally, the paper deals with distributed computing systems, which suggests that it could also belong to the cs.DC (Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing) sub-category. The paper also discusses the performance limits of coded distributed computing systems, which could place it in the cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms) sub-category. The use of codes over erasure channels suggests that the paper could also belong to the cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture) sub-category. Finally, the paper proposes code designs using polar and Reed-Muller codes, which could place it in the cs.SY (Systems and Control) sub-category.
